description: National Nicaragua-The Nicaraguan Ministry for Education is realising distance learning-teleclasses for the first time in the country for primary and secondary students from public schools. These teleclasses will take place from the 1st July to the 21st July 2020 (three weeks) through Channel 6, Channel 15, Radio Nicaragua and on several social media sites.It is expected that the Nicaraguan Ministry of Education turns to the presential format from the 22st July.

description:
The Nicaraguan Ministry of Health announced the 14th July 2020 that they will request to the travellers that want to entry to Nicaragua a negative result of the COVID-19 test, which must have be done before a maximum of 72 hours prior to the entry to the country.
In this regard, the Nicaraguan Ministry of Health declared the same day that non national travellers with symptoms of fever or respiratory symptons will not be allowed to entry to the country and that national travellers with fever or respiratory symptoms will be allowed to entry to the country but that they will be supervised at home.
target_geog_level: All countries

description:
The Nicaraguan Institute of Civil Aviation (Nicaraguan government) announced the 14th July 2020 the beginning of the reopening of the International Airport Augusto C. Sandino and other details about the protocol that the airlines must fulfil (including also the health measures announced by the Nicaraguan Ministry of Health the same day-Resolution 346-2020 regarding the requirements that national and international travellers must comply with to entry to the country).
The airlines will have to present to the Nicaraguan Institute of Civil Aviation their plan to flight against the COVID-19 before restar their operations.
Moreover, it was announced that all the airlines will need to provide some information in order to operate  travellers, humanitarian or repatriation flights.
For instance, they will have to provide a fumigation certificate, a detailed list of travellers entring and exiting the country with a copy of their passports, an insurance certificate, medical certificate and crew licenses. All the information will have to be provided at least 72 hours before the flight operation date.
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Rosario Murillo, the designated Nicaraguan vicepresident, announced the 22th July 2020 the entry of 100 Nicaraguan citizens the 21th July 2020 that were waiting to enter the country from Panamarian shelters due to the COVID-19 situation in the region. Also, she declared that more Nicaraguan citizens were waiting to entry the country in the coming days from Panana.The citizens that entered the country the 21th July had to pass a health check to rule out symptoms of COVID-19 and commit to be under quarantine 14 days at home.
target_geog_level: One or more countries and one or more regional groupings

description:
The Nicaraguan Ministry of Health announced the 14th July 2020 that they will request to the travellers that want to entry to Nicaragua a negative result of the COVID-19 test, which must have be done before a maximum of 72 hours prior to the entry to the country.
In this regard, the Nicaraguan Ministry of Health declared the same day that non national travellers with symptoms of fever or respiratory symptons will not be allowed to entry to the country and that national travellers with fever or respiratory symptoms will be allowed to entry to the country but that they will be supervised at home. UPDATE: The Nicaraguan Ministry of Health updated the Ministerial Resolution Number 346-2020 the 22th July 2020. The aim of this Resolution is to reinforce the epidemiological control of Nicaraguan nationals and travellers that want to entry the country through all the entry points. 
All the travellers will have to show a negative result of the PCR realized in real time to detect the COVID-19. This test must have be done in a period of time not higher than 72 hours before entring the country.
Moreover, if the travellers come from Asia, Africa or Oceania, the PCR which must show a negative result of the COVID-19 must have been done in a period of time not higher than 96 hours before entring the country. 
Non national travellers that want to entry the country with symptons of respiratory problems or flu will not be allowed to entry the country.
National travellers with symptons of respiratory problems or flu will be allowed to entry the country but will have to be under a mandatory quarantine at home.
Travellers that want to entry the country without flu or respiratory problems and a negative result of the PCR to detect the COVID-19 will have freedom of movement in the country but will be under health monitoring 14 days by health workers.
.
target_geog_level: All countries

description: National-Nicaragua. The Nicaraguan Ministry of Health announced the 3th July 2020 the receipt of the donation from the Indian government of their first load of medical assistance to fight against the COVID-19, consisting of 170.000 tablets of hydroxychloroquine. description:
National-Nicaragua. The Nicaraguan Ministry of Health announced the 6th July 2020 the strengthening of the intensive care units from the public hospitals with new equipment to fight against the COVID-19 and other diseases: ventilators with monitors, beds for hospitalisation, stretchers to transport patients and ultrasound devices.
It was said that 70 ventilators with monitors, 40 beds and 40 ultrasound devices will be send to the Nicaraguan public hospitals.
The Nicaraguan Ministry of Health indicated that this new equipment was bought with treasury funds.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: National Nicaragua- "The Nicaraguan Government presented the "White Book to respond to the COVID-19" to the national and internatioal NGOs the 05-25-2020". This White Book details the singular strategy of the Nicaraguan Government to fight against the pandemic (for instance, with preventive measures of hygiene while respecting social distancing but without lockdowns or quarentines)
type_text: The Nicaraguan Government elaborated and presented the strategic and singular document "The White Book to respond to the COVID-19". In Spanish: "Libro Blanco ante la pandemia del COVID-19"
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: National-Nicaragua. "An increase of retaliations and firings of doctors for criticising the government´s lack of transparency and for calling citizens to go into a voluntary quarantine  have been reported. The 10th June 2020 it was reported the firing of 16 doctors because of this issue"

description: Nicaragua-National. The Central Bank of Nicaragua announced the 22th June 2020 a number of measures on monetary policy to face the effects that the pandemic is bringing to the Nicaraguan economy. This institution decided to release up to 4.000 millions of córdobas in domestic currency, which will allow that the banks use this account of money only in the financing of economic activities.
type_text: The Nicaraguan Central Bank adopted a monetary policy with the aim to facilitate the economic activity in the context of this pandemic.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
The Nicaraguan Ministry of Health announced the 17th July 2020 that they will realize the COVID-19 test to the people that are going to travel to other countries and that are being required a negative COVID--19 test to entry the country of destination. This test will have a cost of 150 USD and that will be only realized in the National Health Complex  
Dra. Concepción Palacios in Managua.
Interested people will mandatory have to provide their identification card or passport, the flight tickets or flight itinerary and the proof of payment in the specified bank account number.
type_text: The Nicaraguan Ministry of Health announced the 17th July 2020 that they will realize the COVID-19 test to the people that are going to travel to other countries and that are being required a negative COVID--19 test to entry the country of destination. This test will have a cost of 150 USD
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
National-Nicaragua. The Nicaraguan government will celebrate the Nicaragua Liberation Day the 19th July 2020 (a major public holiday that commemorates the overthrow of the Sommoza family dynasty in Nicaragua in this day in 1979) as a virtual event. 
This event use to be all the years a multitudinous event in Plaza de la Fé in Managua. The Nicaraguan government have not formally declared social distancing.
type_sub_cat: Annually recurring event allowed to occur with certain conditions
target_geog_level: One or more cities within a country
